result.execSummary:
The defendant Natasha Marie Belille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: 320 days county jail.  DE is granted furlough, effective today 4-12-17 until 9:00 am June 17,  2017, as per Order filed, in order for DE to be admitted into inpatient treatment program.
Any unpaid financial obligations are converted to clerk of court collect.  Civil judgment will be entered.

judgments.dispoDesc:
Probation revoked. 
Sentence imposed: 320 days county jail, with credit for 181 days.  Court grants furlough effective immediately for purpose of DE to get treatment.  DE to contact LCO as soon as possible in order to be admitted into program.  DE to sign medical release in order for the court to be able to be updated by LCO and the treatment center with DE's progress in treatment.
Upon notification that the DE successfully completed inpatient treatment, Court will vacate the balance of the jail sentence.  Furlough is granted until June 17th 9:00 am, at which time DE must report to jail.   Court may extend furlough if needed to facilitate ongoing treatment, but DE must keep communication lines open with the court.
All unpaid financial obligations will be converted to clerk of court collect and a civil judgment will be entered.  
Clerk of court to set up payplan for DE effective 4 months from date of sentencing, at $25/month.
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Order regarding furlough

Defendant Natasha Marie Belille in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Defendant Natasha Marie Belille in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation is revoked.  State makes statement regarding sentencing.  Court questions DE directly.  Atty Kirkpatrick makes statement.  DE makes statement and court further questions DE.  Judge brings up possibility of electronic monitoring option for DE.   Atty Marcoux states Sawyer County jail does not have an electronic monitoring system, court officer confirms that.
Sentence imposed: 320 days county jail, with credit for 181 days.  Court grants furlough effective immediately for purpose of DE to get treatment.    DE to contact LCO as soon as possible in order to be admitted into program.  DE to sign medical release in order for the court to be able to be updated with DE's progress in treatment.
Upon notification that the DE successfully completed inpatient treatment, Court will vacate the balance of the jail sentence.  Furlough is granted until June 17th 9:00 am, at which time DE must report to jail.   Court may extend furlough if needed to facilitate ongoing treatment, but DE must keep communication lines open with the court.   Any violations will result in furlough being revoked and full sentence served.
All unpaid financial obligations will be converted to clerk of court collect and a civil judgment will be entered.  
Clerk of court to set up payplan for DE effective 4 months from date of sentencing, at $25/month.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 12, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 26, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Notice of violation, recommended action, statement of hearing rights and receipt.
Waivers and custody decision
Ex 1 and Ex 2 - Motion Hearing

Back on the record 2:40 pm. Parties have reached an agreement.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. Def pleads no contest to ct #1 - found guilty. Ct #2 dismissed and read in.  Court witholds sentence on ct#1, 4 years probation conditions of probation, 31 days county jail with huber. Credit for 31 days time served.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge. Costs of $518 and drug buy money of $90.00 joint and several with Josh Toles.    No contact with Joshua Toles.  Def. to report to Probation & Parole within 24 hours.

Defendant Natasha Marie Belille in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has no pretrial motions pending.  Defense motion presence of Joshua Toles - makes argument.  State makes argument.  Court states witness Joshua Toles does need to be present for trial.  

Motion to suppress statement arguments.  Rusk Cty Sheriff Deputy Matt Wojcik called by state, sworn and testifies.  Cross exam by atty Johansen.  Court questions witness. Re-direct by State.  Ex. 1, certified copy of JOC 11CM284, marked and Ex 2, certified copy of JOC 08CM568, marked.  Both exhibits offered, defense objects, court withholds ruling on exhibits.   State makes argument.  Atty Johansen makes argument.  Court makes findings and denies motion to suppress.  

Defense is requesting a continuance of jury trial which is set for 3-3-16.  Court off record for brief recess.
To suppress stmts
to procure the attendance of witness
